info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 28 at 9:18PM CDT until June 2 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Oklahoma...
Red River Near Dekalb affecting Red River, McCurtain and Bowie Counties.
For the Red River...including Dekalb, Index, Fulton, Shreveport, Coushatta, Grand Ecore...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Red River near Dekalb.
* WHEN...Until Monday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 24.5 feet, Flooding will continue to decrease along the Red River, although bank erosion problems will continue. Minor overflow of low banks will continue, especially on the Oklahoma side of the river.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 25.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 22.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM CDT Wednesday was 25.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 25.7 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.8 feet on 05/09/1995. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: https://water.noaa.gov/wfo/SHV
The next statement will be issued Thursday evening at 930 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY AFTERNOON

area.areaDesc: McCurtain, OK; Bowie, TX; Red River, TX
